title: Reese Witherspoon looks cool in all-black as she takes a break from promoting The Morning Show
text:
She's currently in the Big Apple promoting her new series, The Morning Show.

And Reese Witherspoon enjoyed a break from all her hard work and headed straight to Central Park on Tuesday.

Even though it was drizzly, the actress, 43, was as happy as a clam enjoying the rainy New York weather with a friend.

Getting some fresh air! Reese Witherspoon enjoyed a break from all her hard work on Tuesday and headed to Central Park in New York City

The Legally Blonde star showcased her carefree side as she struck a few poses upon a rock.

Rocking head-to-toe black, Reese was definitely dressed with the gloomy weather in mind.

The actress explored the parking wearing cool black frame glasses, which she eventually swapped out for a classic pair of shades.

She wore a silver chain necklace and threw on a black alligator print purse over her shoulder.

Specs appeal! Witherspoon wore a smart pair of black frame glasses

Happy as a clam! Witherspoon was practically beaming while enjoying a break from all her promotional duties

It's clear Reese was having a grand old time striking poses in the fresh air.

The actress could not stop smiling as she spread her arms wide while posing against the changing leaves.

It certainly was a nice change of pace for Reese, who has been busy plugging her new Apple TV+ series with co-star Jennifer Aniston.

Say cheese! It's clear Reese was having a grand old time striking poses in the fresh air

Strike a pose! Witherspoon spread her arms wide as she soaked up the cool fall weather

The Morning Show is about the inner workings of a popular morning news program, and focuses on newsreader Alex Levy (Aniston), and the aspiring journalist gunning for her job, Bradley Jackson (Reese).

Steve Carrell plays Mitch Kessler, a co-anchor who is fired for a sexual misconduct scandal.

Monday proved to be a particularly busy day for the A-listers.

Not only were they all glammed up at the premiere of their new show, but they also were up bright and early as anchors on Good Morning America.

The Morning Show debuts November 1 on Apple TV+.
